PAR in the After Effects UI PAR returned by the pixelAspect attribute 0.91 0.909091 1 1 1.5 1.5 1.09 1.09402 1.21 1.21212 1.33 1.33333 1.46 1.45869 2 2

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Floating-point value, in the range [0.01..100.0]; read/write.

docs.title: AVItem.proxySource
docs.text: app.project.item(index).proxySource

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The FootageSource being used as a proxy. The attribute is read-only; to change it, call any of the AVItem methods that change the proxy source: setProxy(), setProxyWithSequence(), setProxyWithSolid(), or setProxyWithPlaceholder().

docs.title: Type
docs.text: FootageSource object; read-only.

docs.title: AVItem.time
docs.text: app.project.item(index).time

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The current time of the item when it is being previewed directly from the Project panel. This value is a number of seconds. Use the global method timeToCurrentFormat() to convert it to a string value that expresses the time in terms of frames. It is an error to set this value for a FootageItem whose mainSource is still (item.mainSource.isStill is true).

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Floating-point value; read/write.

docs.title: AVItem.usedIn
docs.text: app.project.item(index).usedIn

docs.title: Description
docs.text: All the compositions that use this AVItem. Note that upon retrieval, the array value is copied, so it is not automatically updated. If you get this value, then add this item into another composition, you must retrieve the value again to get an array that includes the new item.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Array of CompItem objects; read-only.

docs.title: AVItem.useProxy
docs.text: app.project.item(index).useProxy

docs.title: Description
docs.text: When true, a proxy is used for the item. It is set to true by all the SetProxy methods, and to false by the SetProxyToNone() method.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read/write.

docs.title: AVItem.width
docs.text: app.project.item(index).width

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The width of the item, in pixels.

  • In a CompItem, the value is linked to the composition, and is read/write.
  • In a FootageItem, the value is linked to the mainSource object, and is read/write only if the mainSource object is a SolidSource. Otherwise, it is read-only.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Integer, in the range [1..30000]; read/write, except as noted.

docs.title: AVItem.setProxy()
docs.text: app.project.item(index).setProxy(file)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Sets a file as the proxy of this AVItem.

Loads the specified file into a new FileSource object, sets this as the value of the proxySource attribute, and sets useProxy to true.

It does not preserve the interpretation parameters, instead using the user preferences. If the file has an unlabeled alpha channel, and the user preference says to ask the user what to do, the method estimates the alpha interpretation, rather than asking the user.

This differs from setting a FootageItem's mainSource, but both actions are performed as in the user interface.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description file Extendscript File object The file to be used as a proxy.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: None.

docs.title: AVItem.setProxyToNone()
docs.text: app.project.item(index).setProxyToNone()

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Removes the proxy from this AVItem, sets the value of proxySource to null, and sets the value of useProxy to false.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: None.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Nothing.

docs.title: AVItem.setProxyWithPlaceholder()
docs.text: app.project.item(index).setProxyWithPlaceholder(name, width, height ,frameRate, duration)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Creates a PlaceholderSource object with specified values, sets this as the value of the proxySource attribute, and sets useProxy to true. It does not preserve the interpretation parameters, instead using the user preferences.

Note

There is no direct way to set a placeholder as a proxy in the user interface; this behavior occurs when a proxy has been set and then moved or deleted.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description name String The name of the new object. width Integer, in the range [4..30000] The pixel dimensions of the placeholder. height Integer, in the range [4..30000] The pixel dimensions of the placeholder. frameRate Integer, in the range [1..99] Frame rate for the proxy. duration Integer, in the range [0.0..10800.0] The total length in seconds, up to 3 hours.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Nothing.

docs.title: AVItem.setProxyWithSequence()
docs.text: app.project.item(index).setProxyWithSequence(file,forceAlphabetical)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Sets a sequence of files as the proxy of this AVItem, with the option of forcing alphabetical order. Loads the specified file sequence into a new FileSource object, sets this as the value of the proxySource attribute, and sets useProxy to true.

It does not preserve the interpretation parameters, instead using the user preferences. If any file has an unlabeled alpha channel, and the user preference says to ask the user what to do, the method estimates the alpha interpretation, rather than asking the user.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description file Extendscript File object The first file in the sequence. forceAlphabetical Boolean When true, use the "Force alphabetical order" option.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Nothing.

docs.title: AVItem.setProxyWithSolid()
docs.text: app.project.item(index).setProxyWithSolid(color, name, width, height, pixelAspect)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Creates a SolidSource object with specified values, sets this as the value of the proxySource attribute, and sets useProxy to true. It does not preserve the interpretation parameters, instead using the user preferences.

Note

There is no way, using the user interface, to set a solid as a proxy; this feature is available only through scripting.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description color Array of three floating-point values, [R, G, B], in the range [0.0..1.0]. The color of the solid. name String The name of the new object. width, height Integer, in the range [1..30000] The pixel dimensions of the placeholder. pixelAspect Floating-point value, in the range [0.01..100.0] The pixel aspect ratio of the solid.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Nothing.

docs.title: CompItem object
docs.text:
app.project.item(index)

app.project.items[index]

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The CompItem object represents a composition, and allows you to manipulate and get information about it. Access the objects by position index number in a project's item collection.

Info

CompItem is a subclass of AVItem object, which is a subclass of Item object. All methods and attributes of AVItem and Item, in addition to those listed below, are available when working with CompItem.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
Given that the first item in the project is a CompItem, the following code displays two alerts. The first shows the number of layers in the CompItem, and the second shows the name of the last layer in the CompItem.

var firstComp = app.project.item(1);
alert("number of layers is " + firstComp.numLayers);
alert("name of last layer is " + firstComp.layer(firstComp.numLayers).name);

docs.title: CompItem.activeCamera
docs.text: app.project.item(index).activeCamera

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The active camera, which is the front-most camera layer that is enabled. The value is null if the composition contains no enabled camera layers.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: CameraLayer object; read-only.

docs.title: CompItem.bgColor
docs.text: app.project.item(index).bgColor

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The background color of the composition. The three array values specify the red, green, and blue components of the color.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: An array containing three floating-point values, [R, G, B], in the range [0.0..1.0]; read/write.

docs.title: CompItem.counters
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).counters

Note

This functionality was added in After Effects 13.2 (CC2014).

Warning

This method/property is officially undocumented and was found via research. The information here may be inaccurate, and this whole method/property may disappear or stop working some point. Please contribute if you have more information on it!

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
This attribute works app-wide: if changed on one CompItem, it will change it for every CompItem in the project. The value stays until restarting AE. Once restarted, it will revert to false.

This parameter doesn't do anything.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read/write.

docs.title: CompItem.displayStartFrame
docs.text: app.project.item(index).displayStartFrame

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The frame value of the beginning of the composition.

This value is an alternative to calculating the start frame using CompItem.displayStartTime and CompItem.frameDuration to compensate for floating-point problems.

Note

This functionality was added in After Effects 17.1.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Integer; read/write.

docs.title: CompItem.displayStartTime
docs.text: app.project.item(index).displayStartTime

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The time set as the beginning of the composition, in seconds. This is the equivalent of the Start Timecode or Start Frame setting in the Composition Settings dialog box.

Note

As of After Effects 17.1, the minimum value is -10800.0. Before 17.1, the minimum value was 0.0

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Floating-point valuem in the range [-10800.0..86339.0] (-3:00:00:00 to 23:59:00:00); read/write.

docs.title: CompItem.draft3d
docs.text: app.project.item(index).draft3d

docs.title: Description
docs.text: When true, Draft 3D mode is enabled for the Composition panel. This corresponds to the value of the Draft 3D button in the Composition panel.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read/write.

docs.title: CompItem.dropFrame
docs.text: app.project.item(index).dropFrame

docs.title: Description
docs.text: When true, indicates that the composition uses drop-frame timecode. When false, indicates non-drop-frame timecode. This corresponds to the setting in the Composition Settings dialog box.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read/write.

docs.title: CompItem.frameBlending
docs.text: app.project.item(index).frameBlending

docs.title: Description
docs.text: When true, frame blending is enabled for this Composition. Corresponds to the value of the Frame Blending button in the Composition panel.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; if true, frame blending is enabled; read/write.

docs.title: CompItem.frameDuration
docs.text: app.project.item(index).frameDuration

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The duration of a frame, in seconds. This is the inverse of the frameRate value (frames-per-second).

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Floating-point value; read/write.

docs.title: CompItem.hideShyLayers
docs.text: app.project.item(index).hideShyLayers

docs.title: Description
docs.text: When true, only layers with shy set to false are shown in the Timeline panel. When false, all layers are visible, including those whose shy value is true. Corresponds to the value of the Hide All Shy Layers button in the Composition panel.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read/write.

docs.title: CompItem.layers
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layers

docs.title: Description
docs.text: A LayerCollection object that contains all the Layer objects for layers in this composition.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: LayerCollection object; read-only.

docs.title: CompItem.markerProperty
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).markerProperty

Note

This functionality was added in After Effects 14.0 (CC 2017)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
A PropertyGroup object that contains all a composition's markers. Composition marker scripting has the same functionality as Layer markers.

See MarkerValue object.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: PropertyGroup object or null; read-only.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
The following sample code creates a project and composition, then creates two composition markers with different properties

// comp.markerProperty allows you to add markers to a comp.
// It has the same functionality as layer.property("Marker")
var currentProj = app.newProject();
var comp = currentProj.items.addComp("mycomp", 1920, 1080, 1.0, 5, 29.97);
var solidLayer = comp.layers.addSolid([1, 1, 1], "mylayer", 1920, 1080, 1.0);

var compMarker = new MarkerValue("This is a comp marker!");
compMarker.duration = 1;

var compMarker2 = new MarkerValue("Another comp marker!");
compMarker2.duration = 1;

comp.markerProperty.setValueAtTime(1, compMarker);
comp.markerProperty.setValueAtTime(3, compMarker2);

docs.title: CompItem.motionBlur
docs.text: app.project.item(index).motionBlur

docs.title: Description
docs.text: When true, motion blur is enabled for the composition. Corresponds to the value of the Motion Blur button in the Composition panel.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read/write.

docs.title: CompItem.motionBlurAdaptiveSampleLimit
docs.text: app.project.item(index).motionBlurAdaptiveSampleLimit

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The maximum number of motion blur samples of 2D layer motion. This corresponds to the Adaptive Sample Limit setting in the Advanced tab of the Composition Settings dialog box.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Integer (between 16 and 256); read/write.

docs.title: CompItem.motionBlurSamplesPerFrame
docs.text: app.project.item(index).motionBlurSamplesPerFrame

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The minimum number of motion blur samples per frame for Classic 3D layers, shape layers, and certain effects. This corresponds to the Samples Per Frame setting in the Advanced tab of the Composition Settings dialog box.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Integer (between 2 and 64); read/write.

docs.title: CompItem.motionGraphicsTemplateControllerCount
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).motionGraphicsTemplateControllerCount

Note

This functionality was added in After Effects 16.1 (CC 2019)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The number of properties in the Essential Graphics panel for the composition.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Integer; read-only.

docs.title: CompItem.motionGraphicsTemplateName
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).motionGraphicsTemplateName

Note

This functionality was added in After Effects 15.0 (CC 2018)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Read or write the name property in the Essential Graphics panel for the composition.

The name in the Essential Graphics panel is used for the file name of an exported Motion Graphics template (ex., "My Template.mogrt").

The following example will set the name for the active composition and then return it as an alert

app.project.activeItem.motionGraphicsTemplateName = "My Template";
alert(app.project.activeItem.motionGraphicsTemplateName);

docs.title: Type
docs.text: String; read/write.

docs.title: CompItem.numLayers
docs.text: app.project.item(index).numLayers

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The number of layers in the composition.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Integer; read-only.

docs.title: CompItem.preserveNestedFrameRate
docs.text: app.project.item(index).preserveNestedFrameRate

docs.title: Description
docs.text: When true, the frame rate of nested compositions is preserved in the current composition. Corresponds to the value of the "Preserve frame rate when nested or in render queue" option in the Advanced tab of the Composition Settings dialog box.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read/write.

docs.title: CompItem.preserveNestedResolution
docs.text: app.project.item(index).preserveNestedResolution

docs.title: Description
docs.text: When true, the resolution of nested compositions is preserved in the current composition. Corresponds to the value of the "Preserve Resolution When Nested" option in the Advanced tab of the Composition Settings dialog box.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read/write.

docs.title: CompItem.renderer
docs.text: app.project.item(index).renderer

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The current rendering plug-in module to be used to render this composition, as set in the Advanced tab of the Composition Settings dialog box. Allowed values are the members of CompItem.renderers.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: String; read/write.

docs.title: CompItem.renderers
docs.text: app.project.item(index).renderers

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The available rendering plug-in modules. Member strings reflect installed modules, as seen in the Advanced tab of the Composition Settings dialog box.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Array of strings; read-only.

docs.title: CompItem.resolutionFactor
docs.text: app.project.item(index).resolutionFactor

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The x and y downsample resolution factors for rendering the composition. The two values in the array specify how many pixels to skip when sampling; the first number controls horizontal sampling, the second controls vertical sampling. Full resolution is [1, 1], half resolution is [2, 2], and quarter resolution is [4, 4]. The default is [1, 1].

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Array of two integers in the range [1..99]; read/write.

docs.title: CompItem.selectedLayers
docs.text: app.project.item(index).selectedLayers

docs.title: Description
docs.text: All of the selected layers in this composition. This is a 0-based array (the first object is at index 0).

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Array of Layer objects; read-only.

docs.title: CompItem.selectedProperties
docs.text: app.project.item(index).selectedProperties

docs.title: Description
docs.text: All of the selected properties (Property and PropertyGroup objects) in this composition. The first property is at index position 0.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Array of Property and PropertyGroup objects; read-only.

docs.title: CompItem.shutterAngle
docs.text: app.project.item(index).shutterAngle

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The shutter angle setting for the composition. This corresponds to the Shutter Angle setting in the Advanced tab of the Composition Settings dialog box.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Integer, in the range [0..720]; read/write.

docs.title: CompItem.shutterPhase
docs.text: app.project.item(index).shutterPhase

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The shutter phase setting for the composition. This corresponds to the Shutter Phase setting in the Advanced tab of the Composition Settings dialog box.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Integer, in the range [-360..360]; read/write.

docs.title: CompItem.workAreaDuration
docs.text: app.project.item(index).workAreaDuration

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The duration of the work area in seconds. This is the difference of the start-point and end-point times of the Composition work area.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Floating-point value; read/write.

docs.title: CompItem.workAreaStart
docs.text: app.project.item(index).workAreaStart

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The time when the Composition work area begins, in seconds.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Floating-point value; read/write.

docs.title: CompItem.duplicate()
docs.text: app.project.item(index).duplicate()

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Creates and returns a duplicate of this composition, which contains the same layers as the original.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: None.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: CompItem object.

docs.title: CompItem.exportAsMotionGraphicsTemplate()
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).exportAsMotionGraphicsTemplate(doOverWriteFileIfExisting[, file_path])

Note

This functionality was added in After Effects 15.0 (CC 2018)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Exports the composition as a Motion Graphics template. Returns true if the Motion Graphics template is successfully exported, otherwise false.

The name in the Essential Graphics panel is used for the file name of the Motion Graphics template (ex., "My Template.mogrt"). Use the motionGraphicsTemplateName attribute to set the name.

Optionally specify the path to the folder where the Motion Graphics template file is saved. If not specified, the file will be saved in the current user's Motion Graphics Templates folder:

OS Path macOS /Users/<name>/Library/Application Support/Adobe/Common/Motion Graphics Templates/ Windows C:\Users\<name>\AppData\Roaming\Adobe\Common\Motion Graphics Templates\

If the project has been changed since the last time it was saved, After Effects will prompt the user to save the project. To avoid this, use the project save() method before exporting the Motion Graphics template.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description doOverWriteFileIfExisting Boolean Whether to overwrite an existing file of the same name. file_path String Optional. Path to the folder where the file will be saved.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Boolean.

docs.title: CompItem.getMotionGraphicsTemplateControllerName()
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).getMotionGraphicsTemplateControllerName(index)

Note

This functionality was added in After Effects 16.1 (CC 2019)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Gets the name of a single property in the Essential Graphics panel.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description index Integer The index of the EGP property whose name will be returned.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: String; read-only.

docs.title: CompItem.setMotionGraphicsControllerName()
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).setMotionGraphicsControllerName(index, newName)

Note

This functionality was added in After Effects 16.1 (CC 2019)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Sets the name of a single property in the Essential Graphics panel.

Tip

To rename a property as it is added to the EGP, see Property.addToMotionGraphicsTemplateAs().

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description index Integer The index of the EGP property to be renamed. newName String The new name for the EGP property.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: String; read-only.

docs.title: CompItem.layer()
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).layer(index)

app.project.item(index).layer(otherLayer, relIndex)

app.project.item(index).layer(name)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Returns a Layer object, which can be specified by name, an index position in this layer, or an index position relative to another layer.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
Parameter Type Description index Integer, in the range [1..numLayers], where numLayers is the number of layers in the composition The index number of the desired layer in this composition.

or:

Parameter Type Description otherLayer Layer object in this composition. The relIndex value is added to the index value of this layer to find the position of the desired layer. relIndex Integer, in the range [1 - otherLayer.index .. numLayers - otherLayer.index], where numLayers is the number of layers in the composition. The position of the desired layer, relative to otherLayer. This value is added to the otherLayer value to derive the absolute index of the layer to return.

or:

Parameter Type Description name String The name of the desired layer.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Layer object.

docs.title: CompItem.openInEssentialGraphics()
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).openInEssentialGraphics()

Note

This functionality was added in After Effects 15.0 (CC 2018)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Opens the composition in the Essential Graphics panel.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: None.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Nothing.

docs.title: CompItem.openInViewer()
docs.text: app.project.item(index).openInViewer()

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Opens the composition in a Composition panel, and moves the Composition panel to front and gives it focus.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: None.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Viewer object object for the Composition panel, or null if the composition could not be opened.

docs.title: FolderItem object
docs.text: app.project.FolderItem

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The FolderItem object corresponds to a folder in your Project panel. It can contain various types of items (footage, compositions, solids) as well as other folders.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
Given that the second item in the project is a FolderItem, the following code puts up an alert for each top-level item in the folder, showing that item's name.

var secondItem = app.project.item(2);
if (!(secondItem instanceof FolderItem)) {
    alert("problem: second item is not a folder");
} else {
    for (var i = 1; i <= secondItem.numItems; i++) {
        alert("item number " + i + " within the folder is named " + secondItem.item(i).name);
    }
}

docs.title: FolderItem.items
docs.text: app.project.item(index).items

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
An ItemCollection object containing Item object that represents the top-level contents of this folder.

Unlike the ItemCollection in the Project object, this collection contains only the top-level items in the folder. The top-level within the folder is not the same as top-level within the project. Only those items that are top-level in the root folder are also top-level in the Project.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: ItemCollection object; read-only.

docs.title: FolderItem.numItems
docs.text: app.project.item(index).numItems

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The number of items contained in the items collection (folderItem.items.length).

If the folder contains another folder, only the FolderItem for that folder is counted, not any subitems contained in it.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Integer; read-only.

docs.title: FolderItem.item()
docs.text: app.project.item(index).item(subIndex)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Returns the top-level item in this folder at the specified index position.

Note that "top-level" here means top-level within the folder, not necessarily within the project.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description subIndex Integer The position index of the item to retrieve. The first item is at index 1.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Item object.

docs.title: FootageItem object
docs.text: app.project.item(index) app.project.items[index]

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The FootageItem object represents a footage item imported into a project, which appears in the Project panel. These are accessed by position index number in a project's item collection.

Info

FootageItem is a subclass of AVItem object, which is a subclass of Item object. All methods and attributes of AVItem and Item, in addition to those listed below, are available when working with FootageItem.

docs.title: FootageItem.file
docs.text: app.project.item(index).file

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The Extendscript File object for the footage's source file.

If the FootageItem's mainSource is a FileSource, this is the same as FootageItem.mainSource.file. Otherwise it is null.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: File object; read-only.

docs.title: FootageItem.mainSource
docs.text: app.project.item(index).mainSource

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The footage source, an object that contains all of the settings related to that footage item, including those that are normally accessed through the Interpret Footage dialog box. The attribute is read-only. To change its value, call one of the FootageItem "replace" methods. See the FootageSource object, and its three types:

  • SolidSource object
  • FileSource object
  • PlaceholderSource object

If this is a FileSource object, and the footageMissing value is true, the path to the missing footage file is in the FileSource.missingFootagePath attribute.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: FootageSource object; read-only.

docs.title: FootageItem.openInViewer()
docs.text: app.project.item(index).openInViewer()

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Opens the footage in a Footage panel, and moves the Footage panel to front and gives it focus.

Tip

Missing and placeholder footage can be opened using this method, but cannot manually (via double-clicking it).

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: None.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Viewer object for the Footage panel, or null if the footage could not be opened.

docs.title: FootageItem.replace()
docs.text: app.project.item(index).replace(file)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Changes the source of this FootageItem to the specified file.

In addition to loading the file, the method creates a new FileSource object for the file and sets mainSource to that object. In the new source object, it sets the name, width, height, frameDuration, and duration attributes (see AVItem object) based on the contents of the file.

The method preserves interpretation parameters from the previous mainSource object.

If the specified file has an unlabeled alpha channel, the method estimates the alpha interpretation.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description file Extendscript File object The file to be used as the footage main source.

docs.title: FootageItem.replaceWithPlaceholder()
docs.text: app.project.item(index).replaceWithPlaceholder(name, width, height, frameRate, duration)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Changes the source of this FootageItem to the specified placeholder. Creates a new PlaceholderSource object, sets its values from the parameters, and sets mainSource to that object.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description name String The name of the placeholder. width Integer, in the range [4..30000] The width of the placeholder in pixels. height Integer, in the range [4..30000] The height of the placeholder in pixels. frameRate Floating-point value, in the range [1.0..99.0] The frame rate of the placeholder. duration Floating-point value, in the range [0.0..10800.0] The duration of the placeholder in seconds.

docs.title: FootageItem.replaceWithSequence()
docs.text: app.project.item(index).replaceWithSequence(file, forceAlphabetical)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Changes the source of this FootageItem to the specified image sequence.

In addition to loading the file, the method creates a new FileSource object for the file and sets mainSource to that object. In the new source object, it sets the name, width, height, frameDuration, and duration attributes (see AVItem object) based on the contents of the file.

The method preserves interpretation parameters from the previous mainSource object. If the specified file has an unlabeled alpha channel, the method estimates the alpha interpretation.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description file Extendscript File object The first file in the sequence to be used as the footage main source. forceAlphabetical Boolean When true, use the "Force alphabetical order" option.

docs.title: FootageItem.replaceWithSolid()
docs.text: app.project.item(index).replaceWithSolid(color, name, width, height, pixelAspect)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Changes the source of this FootageItem to the specified solid. Creates a new SolidSource object, sets its values from the parameters, and sets mainSource to that object.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description color Array of three floating-point values, [R, G, B], in the range [0.0..1.0]. The color of the solid. name String The name of the solid. width Integer, in the range [4..30000] The width of the solid in pixels. height Integer, in the range [4..30000] The height of the solid in pixels. pixelAspect Floating-point value, in the range [0.01..100.0] The pixel aspect ratio of the solid.

docs.title: Item object
docs.text:
app.project.item(index)

app.project.items[index]

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The Item object represents an item that can appear in the Project panel. The first item is at index 1.

Info

Item is the base class for AVItem object and for FolderItem object, which are in turn the base classes for various other item types, so Item attributes and methods are available when working with all of these item types.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
This example gets the second item from the project and checks that it is a folder. It then removes from the folder any top-level item that is not currently selected. It also checks to make sure that, for each item in the folder, the parent is properly set to the correct folder.

var myFolder = app.project.item(2);
if (!(myFolder instanceof FolderItem)) {
    alert("error: second item is not a folder");
} else {
    var numInFolder = myFolder.numItems;
    //Always run loops backwards when deleting things:
    for (var i = numInFolder; i >= 1; i--) {
        var curItem = myFolder.item(i);
        if (curItem.parentFolder !== myFolder) {
            alert("error within AE: the parentFolder is not set correctly");
        } else {
            if (!curItem.selected) {
                //found an unselected solid.
                curItem.remove();
            }
        }
    }
}

docs.title: Item.comment
docs.text: app.project.item(index).comment

docs.title: Description
docs.text: A string that holds a comment, up to 15,999 bytes in length after any encoding conversion. The comment is for the user's purpose only; it has no effect on the item's appearance or behavior.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: String; read/write.

docs.title: Item.dynamicLinkGUID
docs.text: app.project.item(index).dynamicLinkGUID

docs.title: Description
docs.text: A unique and persistent identification number used for the dynamic link, in form of 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: String; read-only.

docs.title: Item.guides
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).guides

Note

This functionality was added in After Effects 16.1 (CC 2019)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: An array of guide objects, containing orientationType, positionType, and position attributes.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Array; read-only.

docs.title: Item.id
docs.text: app.project.item(index).id

docs.title: Description
docs.text: A unique and persistent identification number used internally to identify an item between sessions. The value of the ID remains the same when the project is saved to a file and later reloaded. However, when you import this project into another project, new IDs are assigned to all items in the imported project. The ID is not displayed anywhere in the user interface.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Integer; read-only.

docs.title: Item.label
docs.text: app.project.item(index).label

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The label color for the item. Colors are represented by their number (0 for None, or 1 to 16 for one of the preset colors in the Labels preferences).

Tip

Custom label colors cannot be set programmatically.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Integer (0 to 16); read/write.

docs.title: Item.name
docs.text: app.project.item(index).name

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The name of the item as displayed in the Project panel.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: String; read/write.

docs.title: Item.parentFolder
docs.text: app.project.item(index).parentFolder

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The FolderItem object for the folder that contains this item. If this item is at the top level of the project, this is the project's root folder (app.project.rootFolder). You can use ItemCollection.addFolder() to add a new folder, and set this value to put items in the new folder.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: FolderItem object; read/write.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
This script creates a new FolderItem in the Project panel and moves compositions into it.

//create a new FolderItem in project, with name "comps"
var compFolder = app.project.items.addFolder("comps");

//move all compositions into new folder by setting
//compItem's parentFolder to "comps" folder
for (var i = 1; i <= app.project.numItems; i++){
    if (app.project.item(i) instanceof CompItem) {
        app.project.item(i).parentFolder = compFolder;
    }
}

docs.title: Item.selected
docs.text: app.project.item(index).selected

docs.title: Description
docs.text: When true, this item is selected. Multiple items can be selected at the same time. Set to true to select the item programmatically, or to false to deselect it.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read/write.

docs.title: Item.typeName
docs.text: app.project.item(index).typeName

docs.title: Description
docs.text: A user-readable name for the item type; for example, "Folder", "Footage", or "Composition". These names are application locale-dependent, meaning that they are different depending on the application's interface language.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: String; read-only.

docs.title: Localized strings
docs.text: Locale Composition Folder Footage en_US Composition Folder Footage de_DE Komposition Ordner Footage es_ES Composición Carpeta Material de archivo fr_FR Composition Dossier Métrage it_IT Composizione Cartella Metraggio ja_JP コンポジション フォルダー フッテージ ko_KR 컴포지션 폴더 푸티지 pt_BR Composição Pasta Gravação ru_ru Композиция Папка Видеоряд zh_CN 合成 文件夹 素材

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
if (/Composition|Komposition|Composición|Composizione|コンポジション|컴포지션|Composição|Композиция|合成/.test(app.project.item(index).typeName)) {
    // item is a composition
} else if (/Folder|Ordner|Carpeta|Dossier|Cartella|フォルダー|폴더|Pasta|Папка|文件夹/.test(app.project.item(index).typeName)) {
    // item is a folder
}

docs.title: Item.addGuide()
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).addGuide(orientationType, position)

Note

This functionality was added in After Effects 16.1 (CC 2019)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Creates a new guide and adds it to the guides object of the Item.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description orientationType Integer 0 for a horizontal guide, 1 for a vertical guide. Any other value defaults to horizontal. position Integer The X or Y coordinate position of the guide in pixels, depending on its orientationType.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Integer; the index of the newly-created guide.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
Adds a vertical guide at 500 pixels on the X axis to the activeItem of a project.

app.project.activeItem.addGuide(1, 500);

docs.title: Item.remove()
docs.text: app.project.item(index).remove()

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Deletes this item from the project and the Project panel. If the item is a FolderItem, all the items contained in the folder are also removed from the project. No files or folders are removed from the disk.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: None.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Nothing.

docs.title: Item.removeGuide()
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).removeGuide(guideIndex)

Note

This functionality was added in After Effects 16.1 (CC 2019)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Removes an existing guide. Choose the guide based on its index inside the Item.guides object.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description guideIndex Integer The index of the guide to be removed.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Nothing.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
Removes the first guide in activeItem.

app.project.activeItem.removeGuide(0);

Warning

Removing a guide will cause all higher guide indexes to shift downward.

docs.title: Item.setGuide()
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).setGuide(position,guideIndex)

Note

This functionality was added in After Effects 16.1 (CC 2019)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Modifies the position of an existing guide. Choose the guide based on its guideIndex inside the Item.guides array.

A guide's orientationType may not be changed after it is created.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description position Integer The new X or Y coordinate position of the guide in pixels, depending on its existing orientationType. guideIndex Integer The index of the guide to be modified.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Nothing.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
Changes the position of the first guide in activeItem to 1200 pixels.

app.project.activeItem.setGuide(1200, 0);

docs.title: ItemCollection object
docs.text: app.project.items

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The ItemCollection object represents a collection of items. The ItemCollection belonging to a Project object contains all the Item objects for items in the project. The ItemCollection belonging to a FolderItem object contains all the Item objects for items in that folder.

Info

ItemCollection is a subclass of Collection object. All methods and attributes of Collection, in addition to those listed below, are available when working with ItemCollection.

docs.title: ItemCollection.addComp()
docs.text: app.project.items.addComp(name, width, height, pixelAspect, duration, frameRate)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Creates a new composition. Creates and returns a new CompItem object and adds it to this collection. If the ItemCollection belongs to the project or the root folder, then the new item's parentFolder is the root folder. If the ItemCollection belongs to any other folder, the new item's parentFolder is that FolderItem.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description name String The name of the composition. width Integer, in the range [4..30000] The width of the composition in pixels. height Integer, in the range [4..30000] The height of the composition in pixels. pixelAspect Floating-point value, in the range [0.01..100.0] The pixel aspect ratio of the composition. duration Floating-point value, in the range [0.0..10800.0] The duration of the composition in seconds. frameRate Floating-point value, in the range [1.0..99.0] The frame rate of the composition.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: CompItem object.

docs.title: ItemCollection.addFolder()
docs.text: app.project.items.addFolder(name)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Creates a new folder. Creates and returns a new FolderItem object and adds it to this collection. If the ItemCollection belongs to the project or the root folder, then the new folder's parentFolder is the root folder. If the ItemCollection belongs to any other folder, the new folder's parentFolder is that FolderItem. To put items in the folder, set the Item.parentFolder attribute

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description name String The name of the folder.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: FolderItem object.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
This script creates a new FolderItem in the Project panel and moves compositions into it.

//create a new FolderItem in project, with name "comps"
var compFolder = app.project.items.addFolder("comps");
//move all compositions into new folder by setting
//comp Item's parentFolder to "comps" folder
for (var i = 1; i <= app.project.numItems; i++) {
    if (app.project.item(i) instanceof CompItem) {
        app.project.item(i).parentFolder = compFolder;
    }
}

docs.title: AVLayer object
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The AVLayer object provides an interface to those layers that contain AVItem objects (composition layers, footage layers, solid layers, text layers, and sound layers).

Info

AVLayer is a subclass of Layer object. All methods and attributes of Layer, in addition to those listed below, are available when working with AVLayer.

Info

AVLayer is a base class for TextLayer object, so AVLayer attributes and methods are available when working with TextLayer objects.

docs.title: AE Properties
docs.text:
Different types of layers have different AE properties. AVLayer has the following properties and property groups:

  • Marker
  • Time Remap
  • Motion Trackers
  • Masks
  • Effects
  • Transform
    • Anchor Point
    • Position
    • Scale
    • Orientation
    • X Rotation
    • Y Rotation
    • Rotation
    • Opacity
  • Layer Styles
  • Geometry Options // Ray-traced 3D
  • Material Options
    • Casts Shadows
    • Light Transmission
    • Accepts Shadows
    • Accepts Lights
    • Appears in Reflections // Ray-traced 3D
    • Ambient
    • Diffuse
    • Specular Intensity
    • Specular Shininess
    • Metal
    • Reflection Intensity // Ray-traced 3D
    • Reflection Sharpness // Ray-traced 3D
    • Reflection Rolloff // Ray-traced 3D
    • Transparency // Ray-traced 3D
    • Transparency Rolloff // Ray-traced 3D
    • Index of Refraction // Ray-traced 3D
  • Audio
    • AudioLevels

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
If the first item in the project is a CompItem, and the first layer of that CompItem is an AVLayer, the following sets the layer quality, startTime, and inPoint.

var firstLayer = app.project.item(1).layer(1);
firstLayer.quality = LayerQuality.BEST;
firstLayer.startTime = 1;
firstLayer.inPoint = 2;

docs.title: AVLayer.adjustmentLayer
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).adjustmentLayer

docs.title: Description
docs.text: true if the layer is an adjustment layer.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read/write.

docs.title: AVLayer.audioActive
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).audioActive

docs.title: Description
docs.text: true if the layer's audio is active at the current time. For this value to be true, audioEnabled must be true, no other layer with audio may be soloing unless this layer is soloed too, and the time must be between the inPoint and outPoint of this layer.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read-only.

docs.title: AVLayer.audioEnabled
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).audioEnabled

docs.title: Description
docs.text: When true, the layer's audio is enabled. This value corresponds to the audio toggle switch in the Timeline panel.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read/write.

docs.title: AVLayer.blendingMode
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).blendingMode

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The blending mode of the layer.

docs.title: Type
docs.text:
A BlendingMode enumerated value; read/write. One of:

  • BlendingMode.ADD
  • BlendingMode.ALPHA_ADD
  • BlendingMode.CLASSIC_COLOR_BURN
  • BlendingMode.CLASSIC_COLOR_DODGE
  • BlendingMode.CLASSIC_DIFFERENCE
  • BlendingMode.COLOR
  • BlendingMode.COLOR_BURN
  • BlendingMode.COLOR_DODGE
  • BlendingMode.DANCING_DISSOLVE
  • BlendingMode.DARKEN
  • BlendingMode.DARKER_COLOR
  • BlendingMode.DIFFERENCE
  • BlendingMode.DISSOLVE
  • BlendingMode.DIVIDE
  • BlendingMode.EXCLUSION
  • BlendingMode.HARD_LIGHT
  • BlendingMode.HARD_MIX
  • BlendingMode.HUE
  • BlendingMode.LIGHTEN
  • BlendingMode.LIGHTER_COLOR
  • BlendingMode.LINEAR_BURN
  • BlendingMode.LINEAR_DODGE
  • BlendingMode.LINEAR_LIGHT
  • BlendingMode.LUMINESCENT_PREMUL
  • BlendingMode.LUMINOSITY
  • BlendingMode.MULTIPLY
  • BlendingMode.NORMAL
  • BlendingMode.OVERLAY
  • BlendingMode.PIN_LIGHT
  • BlendingMode.SATURATION
  • BlendingMode.SCREEN
  • BlendingMode.SUBTRACT
  • BlendingMode.SILHOUETE_ALPHA - note the mispelling of 'SILHOUETTE'!
  • BlendingMode.SILHOUETTE_LUMA
  • BlendingMode.SOFT_LIGHT
  • BlendingMode.STENCIL_ALPHA
  • BlendingMode.STENCIL_LUMA
  • BlendingMode.SUBTRACT
  • BlendingMode.VIVID_LIGHT

docs.title: AVLayer.canSetCollapseTransformation
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).canSetCollapseTransformation

docs.title: Description
docs.text: true if it is legal to change the value of the collapseTransformation attribute on this layer.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read-only.

docs.title: AVLayer.canSetTimeRemapEnabled
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).canSetTimeRemapEnabled

docs.title: Description
docs.text: true if it is legal to change the value of the timeRemapEnabled attribute on this layer.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read-only.

docs.title: AVLayer.collapseTransformation
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).collapseTransformation

docs.title: Description
docs.text: true if collapse transformation is on for this layer.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read/write.

docs.title: AVLayer.effectsActive
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).effectsActive

docs.title: Description
docs.text: true if the layer's effects are active, as indicated by the <f> icon next to it in the user interface.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read/write.

docs.title: AVLayer.environmentLayer
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).environmentLayer

docs.title: Description
docs.text: true if this is an environment layer in a Ray-traced 3D composition. Setting this attribute to true automatically makes the layer 3D (threeDLayer becomes true).

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read/write.

docs.title: AVLayer.frameBlending
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).frameBlending

docs.title: Description
docs.text: true if frame blending is enabled for the layer.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read-only.

docs.title: AVLayer.frameBlendingType
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).frameBlendingType

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The type of frame blending to perform when frame blending is enabled for the layer.

docs.title: Type
docs.text:
A FrameBlendingType enumerated value; read/write. One of:

  • FrameBlendingType.FRAME_MIX
  • FrameBlendingType.NO_FRAME_BLEND
  • FrameBlendingType.PIXEL_MOTION

docs.title: AVLayer.guideLayer
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).guideLayer

docs.title: Description
docs.text: true if the layer is a guide layer.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read/write.

docs.title: AVLayer.hasAudio
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).hasAudio

docs.title: Description
docs.text: true if the layer contains an audio component, regardless of whether it is audio-enabled or soloed.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read-only.

docs.title: AVLayer.hasTrackMatte
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).layer(index).hasTrackMatte

Note

This functionality was updated in After Effects 23.0. Track Matte is no longer dependent on layer order.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
true if this layer has track matte. When true, this layer's trackMatteType value controls how the matte is applied.

See AVLayer.trackMatteType for available track matte types.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read-only.

docs.title: AVLayer.height
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).height

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The height of the layer in pixels.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Floating-point value; read-only.

docs.title: AVLayer.isNameFromSource
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).isNameFromSource

docs.title: Description
docs.text: true if the layer has no expressly set name, but contains a named source. In this case, layer.name has the same value as layer.source.name. false if the layer has an expressly set name, or if the layer does not have a source.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read-only.

docs.title: AVLayer.isTrackMatte
docs.text:
app.project.item(index)layer(index).isTrackMatte

Note

This functionality was updated in After Effects 23.0. Track Matte is no longer dependent on layer order.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: true if this layer is being used as a track matte.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read-only.

docs.title: AVLayer.motionBlur
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).motionBlur

docs.title: Description
docs.text: true if motion blur is enabled for the layer.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read/write.

docs.title: AVLayer.preserveTransparency
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).preserveTransparency

docs.title: Description
docs.text: true if preserve transparency is enabled for the layer.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read/write.

docs.title: AVLayer.quality
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).quality

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The quality with which this layer is displayed.

docs.title: Type
docs.text:
A LayerQuality enumerated value; read/write. One of:

  • LayerQuality.BEST
  • LayerQuality.DRAFT
  • LayerQuality.WIREFRAME

docs.title: AVLayer.samplingQuality
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).layer(index).samplingQuality

Note

This functionality was added in After Effects 12.0 (CC)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Set/get layer sampling method (bicubic or bilinear)

docs.title: Type
docs.text:
A LayerSamplingQuality enumerated value; read/write. One of:

  • LayerSamplingQuality.BICUBIC
  • LayerSamplingQuality.BILINEAR

docs.title: AVLayer.source
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).source

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The source AVItem for this layer. The value is null in a Text layer. Use AVLayer.replaceSource() to change the value.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: AVItem object; read-only.

docs.title: AVLayer.threeDLayer
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).threeDLayer

docs.title: Description
docs.text: true if this is a 3D layer.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read/write.

docs.title: AVLayer.threeDPerChar
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).threeDPerChar

docs.title: Description
docs.text: true if this layer has the Enable Per-character 3D switch set, allowing its characters to be animated off the plane of the text layer. Applies only to text layers.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read/write.

docs.title: AVLayer.timeRemapEnabled
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).timeRemapEnabled

docs.title: Description
docs.text: true if time remapping is enabled for this layer.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read/write.

docs.title: AVLayer.trackMatteLayer
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).layer(index).trackMatteLayer

Note

This functionality was added in After Effects 23.0

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Returns the track matte layer for this layer. Returns null if this layer has no track matte layer.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: AVLayer object; read only.

docs.title: AVLayer.trackMatteType
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).layer(index).trackMatteType

Note

This functionality was updated in After Effects 23.0

Warning

This is a Legacy API we don't recommend using for setting Track Matte Type in new scripts. Please consider using the latest track matte APIs AVLayer.setTrackMatte() and AVLayer.removeTrackMatte() for your tasks.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: If this layer has a track matte, specifies the way the track matte is applied. Specifying the TrackMatteType.NO_TRACK_MATTE type will remove the track matte for this layer and reset the track matte type.

docs.title: Type
docs.text:
A TrackMatteType enumerated value; read/write. One of:

  • TrackMatteType.ALPHA
  • TrackMatteType.ALPHA_INVERTED
  • TrackMatteType.LUMA
  • TrackMatteType.LUMA_INVERTED
  • TrackMatteType.NO_TRACK_MATTE

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
// Returns the current track matte type for myLayer
var type = myLayer.trackMatteType;

// *** We recommend using the new Track Matte APIs for the operations below (See Warning) ***

// Changes the track matte type for myLayer to TrackMatteType.ALPHA_INVERTED
myLayer.trackMatteType = TrackMatteType.ALPHA_INVERTED;

// Removes the track matte and also resets the type
myLayer.trackMatteType = TrackMatteType.NO_TRACK_MATTE;

docs.title: AVLayer.width
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).width

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The width of the layer in pixels.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Floating-point value; read-only.

docs.title: AVLayer.addToMotionGraphicsTemplate()
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).layer(index).addToMotionGraphicsTemplate(comp)

Note

This functionality was added in After Effects 18.0 (2021)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Adds the layer to the Essential Graphics Panel for the specified composition.

Returns true if the layer is successfully added, or otherwise false.

If the layer cannot be added, it is either because it is not a layer type for which media can be replaced (referred to as Media Replacement Layers), or the layer has already been added to the EGP for that composition. After Effects will present a warning dialog if the layer cannot be added to the EGP.

Use the AVLayer.canAddToMotionGraphicsTemplate() method to test whether the layer can be added to a Motion Graphics template.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description comp CompItem object The composition where you wish to add the property to the EGP.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Boolean.

docs.title: AVLayer.addToMotionGraphicsTemplateAs()
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).layer(index).addToMotionGraphicsTemplateAs(comp, name)

Note

This functionality was added in After Effects 18.0 (2021)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Adds the layer to the Essential Graphics Panel for the specified composition.

Returns true if the layer is successfully added, or otherwise false.

If the layer cannot be added, it is either because it is not a layer type for which media can be replaced (referred to as Media Replacement Layers), or the layer has already been added to the EGP for that composition. After Effects will present a warning dialog if the layer cannot be added to the EGP.

Use the AVLayer.canAddToMotionGraphicsTemplate() method to test whether the layer can be added to a Motion Graphics template.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description comp CompItem object The composition where you wish to add the property to the EGP. name String The new name.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Boolean.

docs.title: AVLayer.audioActiveAtTime()
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).audioActiveAtTime(time)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Returns true if this layer's audio will be active at the specified time.

For this method to return true, audioEnabled must be true, no other layer with audio may be soloing unless this layer is soloed too, and the time must be between the inPoint and outPoint of this layer.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description time Floating-point value The time, in seconds.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Boolean.

docs.title: AVLayer.calculateTransformFromPoints()
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).calculateTransformFromPoints(pointTopLeft, pointTopRight, pointBottomRight)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Calculates a transformation from a set of points in this layer.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description pointTopLeft Array of floating-point values, [x, y, z] The top left point coordinates. pointTopRight Array of floating-point values, [x, y, z] The top right point coordinates. pointBottomRight Array of floating-point values, [x, y, z] The bottom right point coordinates.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: An Object with the transformation properties set.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
var newLayer = comp.layers.add(newFootage);
newLayer.threeDLayer = true;
newLayer.blendingMode = BlendingMode.ALPHA_ADD;
var transform = newLayer.calculateTransformFromPoints(tl, tr, bl);
for (var sel in transform) {
    newLayer.transform[sel].setValue(transform[sel]);
}

docs.title: AVLayer.canAddToMotionGraphicsTemplate()
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).layer(index).canAddToMotionGraphicsTemplate(comp)

Note

This functionality was added in After Effects 18.0 (2021)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Test whether or not the layer can be added to the Essential Graphics Panel for the specified composition.

Returns true if the layer can be added, or otherwise false.

If the layer cannot be added, it is either because it is not a layer type for which media can be replaced (referred to as Media Replacement Layers), or the layer has already been added to the EGP for that composition.

Media Replacement layers are recognized as AVLayers with an AVLayer.source set to a FootageItem object (with specific source types) or a CompItem object.

The AVLayer needs to comply with the restrictions below in order to be treated as a Media Replacement layer:

  • Layer.hasVideo should return true.
  • AVLayer.adjustmentLayer should return false.
  • Layer.nullLayer should return false.
  • If the AVLayer.source is a FootageItem object, then FootageItem.FootageSource should not be a SolidSource object.
  • If the AVLayer.source is a FootageItem object and the FootageItem.FootageSource is a FileSource object then that FileSource should not point to a non-media file e.g. a JSX script file.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description comp CompItem object The composition where you wish to add the property to the EGP.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Boolean.

docs.title: AVLayer.compPointToSource()
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).layer(index).compPointToSource()

Note

This functionality was added in After Effects 13.2 (CC 2014.2)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Converts composition coordinates, such as sourcePointToComp, to layer coordinates.

Warning

This value only reflects the first character in the text layer at the current time.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description sourcePointToComp Array of floating-point values, [x, y] Position array of composition coordinates

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Array of ([X,Y]) position coordinates; read-only.

docs.title: AVLayer.openInViewer()
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).openInViewer()

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Opens the layer in a Layer panel, and moves the Layer panel to front and gives it focus.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: None.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Viewer object for the Layer panel, or null if the layer could not be opened (e.g., for text or shape layers, which cannot be opened in the Layer panel).

docs.title: AVLayer.removeTrackMatte()
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).layer(index).removeTrackMatte()

Note

This functionality was added in After Effects 23.0

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Removes the track matte for this layer while preserving the TrackMatteType. See AVLayer.setTrackMatte() for another way of removing track matte.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: None.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
Nothing.

// Sets the track matte layer of myLayer with otherLayer as LUMA type
myLayer.setTrackMatte(otherLayer, TrackMatteType.LUMA);

// Removes the track matte for myLayer but preserves the LUMA type
myLayer.removeTrackMatte();

// Still returns TrackMatteType.LUMA
alert(myLayer.trackMatteType);

docs.title: AVLayer.replaceSource()
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).replaceSource(newSource, fixExpressions)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Replaces the source for this layer.

Warning

If this method is performed on a null layer, the layers isNull attribute is not changed from true. This causes the layer not to be visible in comp viewer and renders.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
Parameter

Type

Description

newSource

AVItem object

The new source AVItem object.

fixExpressions

Boolean

true to adjust expressions for the new source, otherwise false.

Warning

This feature can be resource-intensive; if replacing a large amount of footage, do this only at the end of the operation. See also Project.autoFixExpressions().

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Nothing.

docs.title: AVLayer.setTrackMatte()
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).layer(index).setTrackMatte(trackMatteLayer, trackMatteType)

Note

This functionality was added in After Effects 23.0

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Sets the track matte layer and type for this layer. Passing in null to trackMatteLayer parameter removes the track matte. See AVLayer.removeTrackMatte() for another way of removing track matte.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
Parameter Type Description trackMatteLayer AVLayer The layer to be used as the track matte layer. trackMatteType TrackMatteType enum The type of the track matte to be used.

Warning

Passing in TrackMatteType.NO_TRACK_MATTE as type is invalid and will result in no-op.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Nothing

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
// Sets the track matte layer of myLayer with otherLayer as Alpha type
myLayer.setTrackMatte(otherLayer, TrackMatteType.ALPHA);

// Keeps the same trackMatteLayer and only changes the track matte type
myLayer.setTrackMatte(myLayer.trackMatteLayer, TrackMatteType.LUMA);

// Changes the track matte layer but keep the same track matte type
myLayer.setTrackMatte(newTrackMatteLayer, myLayer.trackMatteType);

// Removes the track matte for myLayer and sets the new specified TrackMatteType
myLayer.setTrackMatte(null, TrackMatteType.ALPHA);
myLayer.setTrackMatte(null, TrackMatteType.NO_TRACK_MATTE);

// Invalid. Nothing happens
myLayer.setTrackMatte(otherLayer, TrackMatteType.NO_TRACK_MATTE);

docs.title: AVLayer.sourcePointToComp()
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).layer(index).sourcePointToComp()

Note

This functionality was added in After Effects 13.2 (CC 2014.2)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Converts layer coordinates, such as boxTextPos, to composition coordinates.

Warning

This value only reflects the first character in the text layer at the current time.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description boxTextPos Array of floating-point values, [x, y] A position array of layer coordinates.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Array of ([X,Y]) position coordinates; read-only.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
// For a paragraph text layer.
// Converts position in layer coordinates to comp coordinates.
var boxTextCompPos = myTextLayer.sourcePointToComp(boxTextLayerPos);

docs.title: AVLayer.sourceRectAtTime()
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).sourceRectAtTime(timeT, extents)

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Retrieves the rectangle bounds of the layer at the specified time index, corrected for text or shape layer content. Use, for example, to write text that is properly aligned to the baseline.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description timeT Floating-point value The time index, in seconds. extents Boolean true to include the extents, otherwise false. Extents apply to shape layers, increasing the size of the layer bounds as necessary.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: A JavaScript object with four attributes, [top, left, width, height].

docs.title: CameraLayer object
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The CameraLayer object represents a camera layer within a composition. Create it using LayerCollection.addCamera(). It can be accessed in an item's layer collection either by index number or by a name string.

Info

CameraLayer is a subclass of Layer object. All methods and attributes of Layer are available when working with CameraLayer.

docs.title: AE Properties
docs.text:
CameraLayer defines no additional attributes, but has different AE properties than other layer types. It has the following properties and property groups:

  • Marker
  • Transform
    • PointofInterest
    • Position
    • Scale
    • Orientation
    • XRotation
    • YRotation
    • Rotation
    • Opacity
  • CameraOptions
    • Zoom
    • DepthofField
    • FocusDistance
    • BlurLevel

docs.title: Layer object
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The Layer object provides access to layers within compositions. It can be accessed from an item's layer collection either by index number or by a name string.

Info

Layer is a subclass of PropertyGroup, which is a subclass of PropertyBase. All methods and attributes of PropertyGroup, in addition to those listed below, are available when working with Layer, with the exception that propertyIndex attribute is set to undefined.

Info

Layer is the base class for CameraLayer object, LightLayer object, and AVLayer object, so Layer attributes and methods are available when working with all layer types. Layers contain AE properties, in addition to their JavaScript attributes and methods. For examples of how to access properties in layers, see PropertyBase object.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
If the first item in the project is a CompItem, this example disables the first layer in that composition and renames it. This might, for example, turn an icon off in the composition.

var firstLayer = app.project.item(1).layer(1);
firstLayer.enabled = false;
firstLayer.name = "DisabledLayer";

docs.title: Layer.autoOrient
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).autoOrient

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The type of automatic orientation to perform for the layer.

docs.title: Type
docs.text:
An AutoOrientType enumerated value; read/write. One of:

  • AutoOrientType.ALONG_PATH Layer faces in the direction of the motion path.
  • AutoOrientType.CAMERA_OR_POINT_OF_INTEREST Layer always faces the active camera or points at its point of interest.
  • AutoOrientType.CHARACTERS_TOWARD_CAMERA Each character in a per-character 3D text layer automatically faces the active camera.
  • AutoOrientType.NO_AUTO_ORIENT Layer rotates freely, independent of any motion path, point of interest, or other layers.

docs.title: Layer.comment
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).comment

docs.title: Description
docs.text: A descriptive comment for the layer.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: String; read/write.

docs.title: Layer.containingComp
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).containingComp

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The composition that contains this layer.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: CompItem object; read-only.

docs.title: Layer.hasVideo
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).hasVideo

docs.title: Description
docs.text: When true, the layer has a video switch (the eyeball icon) in the Timeline panel; otherwise false.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read-only.

docs.title: Layer.id
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).layer(index).id

Note

This functionality was added in After Effects 22.0 (2022)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Instance property on Layer which returns a unique and persistent identification number used internally to identify a Layer between sessions.

The value of the ID remains the same when the project is saved to a file and later reloaded.

However, when you import this project into another project, new IDs are assigned to all Layers in the imported project. The ID is not displayed anywhere in the user interface..

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Integer; read-only.

docs.title: Layer.index
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).index

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The index position of the layer.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Integer, in the range [1..numLayers]; read-only.

docs.title: Layer.inPoint
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).inPoint

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The "in" point of the layer, expressed in composition time (seconds).

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Floating-point value, in the range [-10800.0..10800.0] (minus or plus three hours); read/write.

docs.title: Layer.isNameSet
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).isNameSet

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
true if the value of the name attribute has been set explicitly, rather than automatically from the source.

Tip

This always returns true for layers that do not have a AVLayer.source

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read-only.

docs.title: Layer.label
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).label

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The label color for the item. Colors are represented by their number (0 for None, or 1 to 16 for one of the preset colors in the Labels preferences).

Tip

Custom label colors cannot be set programmatically.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Integer (0 to 16); read/write.

docs.title: Layer.locked
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).locked

docs.title: Description
docs.text: When true, the layer is locked; otherwise false. This corresponds to the lock toggle in the Layer panel.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read/write.

docs.title: Layer.marker
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).marker

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
A PropertyGroup object that contains all a layer's markers. Layer marker scripting has the same functionality as Comp markers.

See MarkerValue object.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: PropertyGroup object or null; read-only.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
The following sample code creates two layer markers with different properties

var solidLayer = comp.layers.addSolid([1, 1, 1], "mylayer", 1920, 1080, 1.0);

var layerMarker = new MarkerValue("This is a layer marker!");
layerMarker.duration = 1;

var layerMarker2 = new MarkerValue("Another comp marker!");
layerMarker2.duration = 1;

solidLayer.marker.setValueAtTime(1, layerMarker);
solidLayer.marker.setValueAtTime(3, layerMarker2);

docs.title: Layer.nullLayer
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).nullLayer

docs.title: Description
docs.text: When true, the layer was created as a null object; otherwise false.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read-only.

docs.title: Layer.outPoint
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).outPoint

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The "out" point of the layer, expressed in composition time (seconds).

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Floating-point value, in the range [-10800.0..10800.0] (minus or plus three hours); read/write.

docs.title: Layer.parent
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).parent

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The parent of this layer; can be null.

Offset values are calculated to counterbalance any transforms above this layer in the hierarchy, so that when you set the parent there is no apparent jump in the layer's transform.

For example, if the new parent has a rotation of 30 degrees, the child layer is assigned a rotation of -30 degrees.

To set the parent without changing the child layer's transform values, use the setParentWithJump method.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Layer object or null; read/write.

docs.title: Layer.selectedProperties
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).selectedProperties

docs.title: Description
docs.text: An array containing all of the currently selected Property and PropertyGroup objects in the layer.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Array of PropertyBase objects; read-only.

docs.title: Layer.shy
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).shy

docs.title: Description
docs.text: When true, the layer is "shy", meaning that it is hidden in the Layer panel if the composition's "Hide all shy layers" option is toggled on.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read/write.

docs.title: Layer.solo
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).solo

docs.title: Description
docs.text: When true, the layer is soloed, otherwise false.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Boolean; read/write.

docs.title: Layer.startTime
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).startTime

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The start time of the layer, expressed in composition time (seconds).

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Floating-point value, in the range [-10800.0..10800.0] (minus or plus three hours); read/write.

docs.title: Layer.stretch
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).stretch

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The layer's time stretch, expressed as a percentage. A value of 100 means no stretch. Values between 0 and 1 are set to 1, and values between -1 and 0 (not including 0) are set to -1.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Floating-point value, in the range [-9900.0..9900.0]; read/write.

docs.title: Layer.time
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).time

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The current time of the layer, expressed in composition time (seconds).

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Floating-point value; read-only.

docs.title: Layer.activeAtTime()
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).activeAtTime(time)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Returns true if this layer will be active at the specified time.

To return true, the layer must be enabled, no other layer may be soloing unless this layer is soloed too, and the time must be between the inPoint and outPoint values of this layer.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description time Floating-point value The time in seconds.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Boolean.

docs.title: Layer.applyPreset()
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).applyPreset(presetName);

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Applies the specified collection of animation settings (an animation preset) to all the currently selected layers of the comp to which the layer belongs. If no layer is selected, it applies the animation preset to a new solid layer.

Predefined animation preset files are installed in the Presets folder, and users can create new animation presets through the user interface.

Warning

The animation preset is applied to the the selected layer(s) of the comp, not to the layer whose applyPreset function is called. Hence, the layer whose applyPreset function is called effectively just determines the comp whose layers are processed.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description presetName Extendscript File object The file containing the animation preset.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Nothing.

docs.title: Layer.copyToComp()
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).copyToComp(intoComp)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Copies the layer into the specified composition. The original layer remains unchanged.

Creates a new Layer object with the same values as this one, and prepends the new object to the LayerCollection object in the target CompItem. Retrieve the copy using into Comp.layer(1).

Copying in a layer changes the index positions of previously existing layers in the target composition.

This is the same as copying and pasting a layer through the user interface.

Note

As of After Effects 13.6, this method no longer causes After Effects to crash when the layer has a parent.

Warning

As of After Effects 13.7 (13.6, has not been tested), if the copied layer has an effect on it and the user undoes the action, After Effects will Crash.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description intoComp CompItem object The target composition.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Nothing.

docs.title: Layer.doSceneEditDetection()
docs.text:
app.project.item(index).layer(index).doSceneEditDetection(applyOptions)

Note

This functionality was added in After Effects 22.3 (2022)

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Runs Scene Edit Detection on the layer that the method is called on and returns an array containing the times of any detected scenes. This is the same as selecting a layer in the Timeline and choosing "Layer > Scene Edit Detection" with the single argument determining whether the edits are applied as markers, layer splits, pre-comps, or are not applied to the layer.

Just as in the UI, doSceneEditDetection will fail and error if called on a non-video layer or a video layer with Time Remapping enabled.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
Parameter

Type

Description

applyOptions

SceneEditDetectionMode enum

How the detected edits will be applied. One of:

  • SceneEditDetectionMode.MARKERS: Create markers at edit points.
  • SceneEditDetectionMode.SPLIT: Split layer.
  • SceneEditDetectionMode.SPLIT_PRECOMP: Split layer at edit points and pre-compose each one.
  • SceneEditDetectionMode.NONE: Detected edits are not applied to the layer.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Array of floating-point values; the times of the detected edit points expressed in composition time.

docs.title: Layer.duplicate()
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).duplicate()

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Duplicates the layer. Creates a new Layer object in which all values are the same as in this one. This has the same effect as selecting a layer in the user interface and choosing Edit > Duplicate, except the selection in the user interface does not change when you call this method.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: None.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Layer object.

docs.title: Layer.moveAfter()
docs.text: app.project.item(index).layer(index).moveAfter(layer)

docs.title: Description
